All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
ANSIColor
Enumeration representing some Ansi escape codes for stylizing the output.
ApplicationGUI
ApplicationGUI runs and represents the client in a Graphical User interface
ApplicationTUI
ApplicationTUI runs the client in a text-based user interface
Availability
Enumeration representing the availability of a Tile stored in Playground.
Back
Back is a class that extends Face and represents the back of the face
BackTest
Test to check whether two back cards match or not, depending on their attributes.
BoardPane
BoardPane represents the pane in which golden/resource decks and face up cards resides, along with common objective cards
CalculateBackPoints
Strategy used to calculate the points for all type of cards in its back side
CalculateCorners
Strategy used for golden cards that add points based on number of corners covered after it's placement
CalculateNoCondition
Strategy used to calculate points in a card that doesn't require to fulfill any condition
CalculatePoints
Calculate Points is an interface capable of calculating the points earned depending on the particular encountered.
CalculateResources
Strategy used for golden cards which add points based on the number of visible resources present in the playground
CalculateResources.ConditionSymbolMapper
Condition-Symbol Mapper class creates a symmetrical map between Condition and Symbol enumerations.
Card
Card represents the card It has front and back
CardColor
Enumeration representing the possible colors of the cards.
CardsLoader
Loads cards and give them to the model
Chat
Registers messages that will be sent to the server.
ChatDatabase
Chat database to store all messages sent by players.
ChooseColor
This class is responsible for managing the choice of the token color.
ChooseColorMessage
ChooseColorMessage represents the message containing the color chosen by the player.
ChooseObjective
This class is responsible for managing the choice of the secret objective card.
ChooseStarter
This class is responsible for choosing the starter card side and its placement.
Client
The Client class represents the endpoint of a connection with the server.
ClientActions
This interface represents all methods/actions that can be invoked from clients
ClientApplication
ClientApplication is an interface that allows applications to run in the client.
ClientBoard
Representation of the player's playing area.
ClientCard
Represents a card in the client's side.
ClientController
The Client Controller modifies the model that is present in the client and the Model using the virtual server in response to an action performed in the view.
ClientFace
Represents the Face card in the client's side.
ClientGame
Representation of the game in the client's side.
ClientHandler
The ClientHandler interface defines the methods used to control the client representation on the server side.
ClientMain
ClientMain is the class that starts the client in a GUI/TUI interface and in an RMI/Socket communication
ClientObjectiveCard
Represents the objective card in the client's side.
ClientPlayer
Representation of the player in the client's side.
ClientPlayground
Representation of the player's playground.
ClientRMI
The ClientRMI defines the methods to handle an RMI connection and inherits from Client the methods to update the client's model and view.
ClientSocket
The ClientSocket defines the methods to handle a Socket connection and inherits from Client the methods to update the client's model and view.
ClientTile
Representation of a tile contained at a specific position of Client's Playground.
ClientTUI
Client TUI represents the client that uses a Text-based user interface
ClientUtil
ClientUtil is the class that facilitates TUIs printing
Condition
Enumeration representing the requisite conditions for obtaining the points indicated on the card
ConnectionScene
ConnectionScene is the controller concerning connection scene
ConnectMessage
ConnectMessage represents the message that allows a player to connect to the game.
Controller
The Controller class manages the entry of players through the use of a lobby, as well as their subsequent disconnection.
Corner
Corner represents the corner of a card
CornerPosition
Enumeration representing the possible positions of the corners
CrashScene
CrashScene is the controller concerning crash scene
Deck<T>
Deck represents a T deck
DeckType
Enumeration representing the type of the deck
DeserializationHandler<T>
Handles the deserialization of the object T
DisconnectMessage
DisconnectMessage represents the message that allows a player to disconnect from the game.
Draw
This class is responsible for drawing all kind of cards from the moment in which the secret objective card is chosen until the moment in which the last card is drawn before the end of the game.
DrawablePlayground
DrawlablePlayground is the class responsible for managing the playground's drawing
DrawMessage
DrawMessage represents the message that allows a player to draw a card.
EmptyDeckException
Empty Deck Exception is thrown when the deck of cards is empty.
EndScene
EndScene is the controller concerning the end scene
ExceedingPlayerMessage
ExceedingPlayerMessage represents the message indicating the player who has exceeded the limit set by the first player that he has exceeded the limit.
ExceptionsTUI
This enum contains the possible exceptions that can be thrown while running TUI interface
Face
Immutable class representing the Face card.
FaceTest
Test to check the correct differentiation between back and front faces
FittablePlaygroundException
Fittable Playground Exception is thrown when the player attempts to move into an already represented playground offset
Front
Front is a class that extends Face and represents the front of the face
FullLobbyException
Full Lobby Exception is thrown when the game hasn't started but the lobby is full
FullLobbyMessage
FullLobbyMessage represents the message indicating the fullness of the lobby.
Game
Representation of the game.
GameActions
The interface defines all the game actions available to a player.
GameListener
 
GamePhase
Representation of a possible game's state.
GameRequest
This interface represents all methods/actions that can be invoked from clients
GameScene
GameScene is the controller concerning game scene
GameTest
Test to check the correct functioning of the Game and its phases
GoldenFront
GoldenFront is a class that extends Front and represents the front of a golden card
GoldenFrontTest
Test to check whether two golden front cards match or not, depending on their attributes.
GUICards
GUICards represents the cards in the Graphical User Interface
GUICircle
GUICircle creates the circles containing the colors of the player tokens
GUIPlayground
GUIPlayground represents the playground in the Graphical User Interface
GUIUtil
GUIUtil is the class that facilitates GUIs realization
HeartBeat
The HeartBeat class keeps track of the existence of the remote endpoint which can be the server for the client or the client for the server.
HeartBeatHandler
 
HeartBeatListener
 
HeartBeatMessage
HeartBeatMessage represents the message containing the sender and the id number of the message.
Icon
Enumeration representing the icons used in GUIs interface
InterfaceAdaptor<T>
Custom interface adapter used for serializing and deserializing
InvalidCardDimensionException
Invalid Card Dimension Exception is thrown when the card dimensions provided aren't valid, that's because, the card must have an odd dimension
InvalidCardIdException
Invalid Card ID Exception is thrown when the provided id doesn't match with any existing card.
InvalidCardRepresentationException
Invalid Card Representation Exception is thrown when the card has an invalid representation respect to the playground dimension
InvalidColorException
Invalid Color Exception is thrown when the player attempts to select a color that has already been selected
InvalidFaceUpCardException
Invalid FaceUp Card Exception is thrown when the provided id doesn't match with any face up card.
InvalidGamePhaseException
Invalid Game Phase Exception is thrown when an attempt is made to perform an action that is not allowed at a given phase of the game
InvalidIdForDrawingException
Invalid ID For Drawing Exception is thrown when the card id isn't valid for drawing
InvalidMessageException
Invalid Message Exception is thrown when the author doesn't match the sender or the recipient is an invalid username
InvalidPlayerActionException
Invalid Player Action Exception is thrown when the player tries to perform an action that is not allowed
InvalidPlayersNumberException
Invalid Players Number Exception is thrown when the number of players established by the first player is not within the specified range
InvalidUsernameException
Invalid Username Exception is thrown when the player tries to enter a game using a name that is not present at the beginning of the game or enters with a name that is already registered in the game
JsonDeserializerTest
Test to check the correct operation of the deserializer
ListenerHandler<ListenerType>
ListenerHandler adds, removes and notifies listeners
Lobby
Class representing the lobby of the game.
LobbyListener
 
LobbyScene
 
Message
Message sent by players.
NetworkMessage
Network Message represents the messages passed through the network.
NonexistentPlayerException
Nonexistent Player Exception is thrown when the searched player doesn't exist.
NotAvailableUsername
 
NotExistingFaceUp
Not Existing Face Up is thrown when in a given position, no face up card is found
Notifier<ReceiverType>
 
ObjectiveCard
Immutable class representing the objective card.
ObjectivePositionCard
Corresponds to the card that gives points to the player when the player places them in accordance with the pattern.
ObjectiveResourceCard
Corresponds to the card that gives points to the player when she/he manges to collect at least one pre-defined set of resources and this set is visible in her/his playground.
PhaseHandler
Class that handles the game's phases.
PhaseHandlerTest
Test to check the correct game phase transition
Place
This class is responsible for the placement of all the cards from the moment in which the secret objective card is chosen until the moment in which the last card is placed at the end of the game.
PlaceCardMessage
PlaceCardMessage represents the message that allows a player to place a card in the playground.
PlaceObjectiveMessage
PlaceObjectiveMessage represents the message containing the objective card chosen by the player.
PlaceStarterMessage
PlaceStarterMessage represents the message that allows a player to place the starter card in the playground.
PlainGameListener
 
Player
Representation of the player's state.
PlayerAction
A class containing all methods representing possible player's action.
PlayerColor
Enumeration representing the possible token colors of the players
PlayerInfoPane
PlayerInfoPane represents the pane in which player's cards, rank, resources and switchPlayground resides
PlayerState
Enumeration representing the states of the player's actions
Playground
Representation of the player's playground.
Playground.NotEnoughResourcesException
Exception thrown when the resources aren't enough.
Playground.UnavailablePositionException
Exception thrown when the position is unavailable.
PlaygroundInfoPane
PlaygroundInfoPane represents the pane in which player's playground resides.
Position
This class represents a position on a hypothetical Cartesian plane with x and y axes.
RankPane
RankPane represents the pane containing the player's rank and score
ReportErrorMessage
ReportErrorMessage represents the message containing the error details.
ResourcePane
ResourcePane represents the pane containing the player's current resources
ResultOfLogin
ResultOfLogin represents the message containing the result of the login
RMIHandler
 
SceneController
SceneController is an interface for scene controllers.
SceneType
Enumeration representing the possible scene types
SelectUsernameScene
SelectUsernameScene is the controller concerning selectUsername scene
SendChatMessage
SendChatMessage represents the message containing the message to be sent in chat.
Server
The class represents the server to which clients connect.
ServerForSocket
Server notifies the controller of changes made by the player in the view when Socket communication is used.
ServerHandler
Server Handler processes and sends the incoming commands to ClientSocket.
ServerRMI
ServerRMI is the remote reference for the client as if they called them locally.
SetPlayerNumberMessage
SetPlayerNumberMessage represents the message containing the number of players.
SetupScene
SetupScene is the controller concerning set-up scene
ShowWinnersMessage
ShowWinnersMessage represents the message containing the winners of the game.
Side
Enumeration representing the side of a card.
SocketHandler
Sends the commands received by the Server Socket to the Client Socket.
SuspendedGameException
Suspended Game Exception is thrown when the player attempts to perform an action, but the game is suspended
Symbol
Enumeration representing the symbols that may occur.
Tile
Representation of a tile contained at a specific position of Playground.
TUIActions
This enumeration represents the actions that the player can perform and their descriptions.
TUIException
TUI Exception is thrown when an error occurs during the TUI running
TurnCompletion
Class to handle turn completion after joining or leaving the game.
Type
Enumeration representing the means by which the client interacts with the server and conversely.
UndrawablePlaygroundException
UndrawablePlaygroundException is thrown when an error occurs during the playground representation design.
UnInitializedPlaygroundException
Uninitialized Playground Exception is thrown when an attempt is made for printing the playground, but the playground has not been initialized
UnReachableServerException
Unreachable Server Exception is thrown when the server isn't accessible.
UpdateAfterConnectionMessage
UpdateAfterConnectionMessage represents the message containing the representation of the game after the connection of the number of players that was set at the beginning of the game.
UpdateAfterDrawMessage
UpdateAfterDrawMessage represents the message containing the new information after a draw.
UpdateAfterLobbyCrashMessage
UpdateAfterLobbyCrashMessage represents the message indicating the crash of the lobby.
UpdateAfterPlaceMessage
UpdateAfterPlaceMessage represents the message containing the updated position map, the new available position, the new resources, the earned points, the position, the side and the placed card.
UpdateChatMessage
UpdateChatMessage represents the message containing the message to update the chat.
UpdateColorMessage
UpdateColorMessage represents the message containing the color to update the player's color.
UpdateCreatorMessage
UpdateCreatorMessage represents the message that executes the lobby after the arrival of the first player.
UpdateCurrentPlayerMessage
UpdateCurrentPlayerMessage represents the message containing the new current player and his current phase.
UpdateObjectiveCardMessage
UpdateObjectiveCardMessage represents the message containing the chosen objective card with which to update.
UpdatePlayersInLobbyMessage
UpdatePlayersInLobbyMessage represents the message containing the new players to add to the lobby.
UpdatePlayerStatusMessage
UpdatePlayerStatusMessage represents the message containing the status of the player.
UpdateSuspendedGameMessage
UpdateSuspendedGameMessage represents the message indicating the suspension of the game.
View
Methods do not need any argument, as information are retrieved directly from the ClientGame after being updated
VirtualServer
This class defines a "virtual server" and represents the means by which the server interacts with the client.
VirtualView
This class defines a "virtual client" and represents the means by which the client interacts with the server.
